Questions: Which question no longer concerns the modern software engineer?
Incorrect Answers: Why does software take a long time to finish?/Why does it cost so much to develop a piece of software?/Why can’t software errors be removed from products prior to delivery?
Correct Answer: Why does computer hardware cost so much?

Questions: Software is a product and can be manufactured using the same technologies used for other engineering artifacts
Software deteriorates rather than wears out because
Incorrect Answers: Software suffers from exposure to hostile environments/Defects are more likely to arise after software has been used often/Software spare parts become harder to order
Correct Answer: Multiple change requests introduce errors in component interactions

Questions: WebApps are a mixture of print publishing and software development, making their development outside the realm of software engineering practice.
There are no real differences between creating WebApps and MobileApps.
In its simplest form an external computing device may access cloud data services using a web browser.
Product line software development depends the reuse of existing software components to provide software engineering leverage.
Which of the items listed below is not one of the software engineering layers?
Software engineering umbrella activities are only applied during the initial phases of software development projects.
Which of these are the 5 generic software engineering framework activities?
Incorrect Answers: communication, risk management, measurement, production, reviewing/analysis, designing, programming, debugging, maintenance/analysis, planning, designing, programming, testing

Questions: Planning ahead for software reuse reduces the cost and increases the value of the systems into which they are incorporated.
he essence of software engineering practice might be described as understand the problem, plan a solution, carry out the plan, and examine the result for accuracy.
In agile process models the only deliverable work product is the working program.
A most software development projects are initiated to try to meet some business need.
In general software only succeeds if its behavior is consistent with the objectives of its designers.
Which of the following are recognized process flow types?
Incorrect Answers:
Concurrent process flow/Iterative process flow/Linear process flow
/Spiral process flow

Questions: The communication activity is best handled for small projects using six distinct actions (inception, elicitation, elaboration, negotiation, specification, validation).
A good software development team always uses the same task set for every project to insure high quality work products
Software processes can be constructed out of pre-existing software patterns to best meet the needs of a software project.
Which of these are standards for assessing software processes?
The waterfall model of software development is
Incorrect Answers: A good approach when a working program is required quickly./The best approach to use for projects with large development teams./An old fashioned model that is rarely used any more.
Correct Answer: A reasonable approach when requirements are well defined.

Questions: The incremental model of software development is
Incorrect Answers: A reasonable approach when requirements are well defined./The best approach to use for projects with large development teams./A revolutionary model that is not used for commercial products.
Correct Answer: A good approach when a working core product is required quickly.

Questions: Evolutionary software process models
Incorrect Answers: Are iterative in nature./Can easily accommodate product requirements changes./Do not generally produce throwaway systems.

Questions: The prototyping model of software development is
Incorrect Answers: A reasonable approach when requirements are well defined./The best approach to use for projects with large development teams./A risky model that rarely produces a meaningful product.
Correct Answer: A risky model that rarely produces a meaningful product.

Questions: The spiral model of software development
Incorrect Answers: Ends with the delivery of the software product./Is more chaotic than the incremental model./All of the above.
Correct Answer: Includes project risks evaluation during each iteration.

Questions: The concurrent development model is
Incorrect Answers: Another name for concurrent engineering./Defines events that trigger engineering activity state transitions./Only used for development of parallel or distributed systems./Used whenever a large number of change requests are anticipated.

Questions: The component-based development model is
Incorrect Answers: Only appropriate for computer hardware design./Not able to support the development of reusable components./Not cost effective by known quantifiable software metrics.
Correct Answer: Dependent on object technologies for support.

Questions: The formal methods model of software development makes use of mathematical methods to
Incorrect Answers: Define the specification for computer-based systems./Develop defect free computer-based systems./Verify the correctness of computer-based systems.

Questions: Which of these is not one of the phase names defined by the Unified Process model for software development?
Correct Answer: Practitioner requires careful supervision by the project manager.

Questions: Which of these is not a characteristic of Personal Software Process?
Incorrect Answers: Emphasizes personal measurement of work product./Individual practitioner is responsible for estimating and scheduling./Practitioner is empowered to control quality of software work products.
Correct Answer: Show managers how to reduce costs and sustain quality

Questions: Which of these are objectives of Team Software Process?
Incorrect Answers: Accelerate software process improvement/Allow better time management by highly trained professionals/Build self-directed software teams/Show managers how to reduce costs and sustain quality

Questions: Process technology tools allow software organizations to compress schedules by skipping unimportant activities.
It is generally accepted that one cannot have weak software processes and create high quality end products.
Agility is nothing more than the ability of a project team to respond rapidly to change.
Which of the following is not necessary to apply agility to a software process?
Incorrect Answers: Only essential work products are produced/Process allows team to streamline tasks/Uses incremental product delivery strategy
Correct Answer: Eliminate the use of project planning and testing

Questions: How do you create agile processes to manage unpredictability?
Incorrect Answers: Requirements gathering must be conducted very carefully/Risk analysis must be conducted before planning takes place/Software increments must be delivered in short time periods
Correct Answer: Software processes must adapt to changes incrementally

Questions: In agile software processes the highest priorities is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software.
In agile development it is more important to build software that meets the customers’ needs today than worry about features that might be needed in the future.
What are the four framework activities found in the Extreme Programming (XP) process model?
Incorrect Answers: analysis, design, coding, testing/planning, analysis, design, coding/planning, analysis, coding, testing

Questions: All agile process models conform to a greater or lesser degree to the principles stated in the “Manifesto for Agile Software Development”.
Which is not one of the key questions that is answered by each team member at each daily Scrum meeting?
Incorrect Answers: What did you do since the last meeting?/What is the cause of the problem you are encountering?/What do you plan to accomplish be the next team meeting?

Questions: The Dynamic Systems Development Method (DSDM) suggests a philosophy that is based on the Pareto principle (80% of the application can be delivered in 20% of the time required to build the complete application).
Agile Modeling (AM) provides guidance to practitioner during which of these software tasks?
Agile Unified Process uses the classic UP phased activities (inception, elaboration, construction, transition) to help the team visualize the overall process flow.
Human aspects of software engineering are not relevant in today’s agile process models.
Which of the following is not an important trait of an effective software engineer?
Incorrect Answers: Attentive to detail/Brutally honest/Resilient under pressure

Questions: Group communication and collaboration are as important as the technical skills of an individual team member to the success of a team.
Teams with diversity in the individual team member skill sets tend to be more effective than teams without this diversity.
Which of the following can contribute to team toxicity?
Incorrect Answers: Frenzied work atmosphere/Inadequate budget/Poorly coordinated software process/Unclear definition of team roles

Questions: Software engineering team structure is independent of problem complexity and size of the expected software products.
Agile teams are allowed to self-organize and make their own technical decisions.
In XP a metaphor is used as a device to facilitate communications among customers, team members, and managers?
Using an established social media platform negates the need to be concerned about privacy or security.
Use of cloud services can speed up information sharing among software team members?
In collaborative development environments, metrics are used to reward and punish team members.
Which of these factors complicate decision-making by global software teams
Incorrect Answers: Complexity of problem/Different views of the problem/Law of unitended consequences/Risk associated with decision

Questions: Software engineering principles have about a three year half-life.
Which of the following is not one of core principles of software engineering practice?
Incorrect Answers: All design should be as simple as possible, but no simpler./A software system exists only to provide value to its users./Remember that you produce others will consume.
Correct Answer: Pareto principle (20% of any product requires 80% of the effort).

Questions: Every communication activity should have a facilitator to make sure that the customer is not allowed to dominate the proceedings.
The agile view of iterative customer communication and collaboration is applicable to all software engineering practice.
One reason to involve everyone on the software team in the planning activity is to
Incorrect Answers: adjust the granularity of the plan/control feature creep/understand the problem scope
Correct Answer: get all team members to “sign up” to the plan

Questions: Project plans should not be changed once they are adopted by a team.
Requirements models depict software in which three domains?
Incorrect Answers: architecture, interface, component/cost, risk, schedule/None of the above

Questions: The design model should be traceable to the requirements model?
Teams using agile software practices do not generally create models.
Which of the following is not one of the principles of good coding?
Incorrect Answers: Create unit tests before you begin coding/Create unit tests before you begin coding/Write self-documenting code, not program documentation
Correct Answer: Refractor the code after you complete the first coding pass

Questions: A successful test I ones that discovers at least one as-yet undiscovered error.
Which of the following are valid reasons for collecting customer feedback concerning delivered software?
Incorrect Answers: Allows developers to make changes to the delivered increment/Delivery schedule can be revised to reflect changes/Developers can identify changes to incorporate into next increment

Questions: Larger programming teams are always more productive than smaller teams.
Requirements engineering is a generic process that does not vary from one software project to another.
During project inception the intent of the of the tasks are to determine
Incorrect Answers: basic problem understanding/nature of the solution needed/people who want a solution/none of the above

Questions: Three things that make requirements elicitation difficult are problems of
A stakeholder is anyone who will purchase the completed software system under development.
It is relatively common for different customers to propose conflicting requirements, each arguing that his or her version is the right one.
Which of the following is not one of the context-free questions that would be used during project inception?
Incorrect Answers: What will be the economic benefit from a good solution?/Who is behind the request for work?/Who will use the solution?
Correct Answer: Who will pay for the work?

Questions: Non-functional requirements can be safely ignored in modern software development projects.
In collaborative requirements gathering the facilitator
Incorrect Answers: arranges the meeting place/can not be a customer/must be an outsider

Questions: Which of the following is not one of the requirement classifications used in Quality Function Deployment (QFD)?
The work products produced during requirement elicitation will vary depending on the
Incorrect Answers: size of the budget/size of the product being built /software process being used/stakeholders needs

Questions: User stories are complete descriptions the user needs and include the non-functional requirements for a software increment.
Developers and customers create use-cases to help the software team understand how different classes of end-users will use functions.
Use-case actors are always people, never system devices.
The result of the requirements engineering task is an analysis model that defines which of the following problem domain(s)?
Analysis patterns facilitate the transformation of the analysis model into a design model by suggesting reliable solutions to common problems.
In agile process models requirements engineering and design activities are interleaved.
In win-win negotiation, the customer’s needs are met even though the developer’s need may not be.
In requirements validation the requirements model is reviewed to ensure its technical feasibility.
The most common reason for software project failure is lack of functionality.
Which of these is not an element of a requirements model?
Which of the following is not an objective for building a requirements model?
Incorrect Answers: define set of software requirements that can be validated/describe customer requirements/establish basis for software design
Correct Answer: develop an abbreviated solution for the problem

Questions: Object-oriented domain analysis is concerned with the identification and specification of reusable capabilities within an application domain.
In structured analysis models focus on the structure of the classes defined for a system along with their interactions.
Creation and refinement of use cases if an important part of scenario-based modeling.
It is important to consider alternative actor interactions when creating a preliminary use case.
Brainstorming is one technique that may be used to derive a complete set of use case exceptions.
In many cases there is no need to create a graphical representation of a usage scenario.

UML swimnlane diagrams allow you to represent the flow of activities by showing the actors having responsibility for creating each data element.
Which of the following should be considered as candidate objects in a problem space?
In the grammatical parse of a processing narrative the nouns become object candidates in the analysis model.
Attributes are chosen for an object by examining the problem statement and identifying the entities that appear to be related.
Which of the following is not one of the broad categories used to classify operations?

Which of the following items does not appear on a CRC card?
Class responsibilities are defined by

Questions: A stereotype is the basis for class reuse in UML modeling.
An analysis package involves the categorization of analysis model elements into useful groupings.
